meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'rad': more excellent or exciting.
meanings.sent1: The new bike is radder than the old one.
meanings.sent2: She thought the movie was radder than she expected.
meanings.sent3: His dance moves were so radder that everyone cheered.
meanings.sent4: The radder colors of the sunset painted the sky beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of accomplishment was even radder than winning the race.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'radical': more extreme or unconventional.
meanings.sent1: Her outfit choice was radder than anyone else's.
meanings.sent2: The decision to go skydiving was definitely radder than staying home.
meanings.sent3: The radder idea of having a picnic in the rain made them laugh.
meanings.sent4: The radder approach to problem-solving led to unexpected solutions.
meanings.sent5: The radder art piece challenged traditional norms and sparked discussions.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'radiant': more bright or glowing.
meanings.sent1: The radder sunflowers stood out in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The gemstone looked even radder under the light.
meanings.sent3: Her smile was so radder that it lit up the room.
meanings.sent4: The radder stars in the night sky seemed to twinkle brighter.
meanings.sent5: The radder moonlight cast a magical glow over the lake.
